text:
I have a plot that I can't save or display without an exception. Here is the exception I get when trying to display the plot:
```ERROR: MethodError: no method matching shadertype(::FileIO.File{FileIO.DataFormat{:UNKNOWN},String})
Closest candidates are:
  shadertype(::GLMakie.GLAbstraction.Shader) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLShader.jl:63
  shadertype(::FileIO.File{FileIO.DataFormat{:GLSLShader},Name} where Name) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLShader.jl:64
  shadertype(::AbstractString) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLShader.jl:67
Stacktrace:
 [1] compile_shader(::String, ::String) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLShader.jl:145
 [2] (::GLMakie.GLAbstraction.var"#53#54"{String,Dict{String,String},Dict{Symbol,Any}})() at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLShader.jl:170
 [3] get!(::GLMakie.GLAbstraction.var"#53#54"{String,Dict{String,String},Dict{Symbol,Any}}, ::Dict{String,Array{String,1}}, ::String) at ./dict.jl:450
 [4] get_template!(::String, ::Dict{String,String}, ::Dict{Symbol,Any}) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLShader.jl:162
 [5] gl_convert(::GLMakie.GLAbstraction.LazyShader, ::Dict{Symbol,Any}) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLShader.jl:250
 [6] GLMakie.GLAbstraction.RenderObject(::Dict{Symbol,Any}, ::GLMakie.GLAbstraction.LazyShader, ::GLMakie.PostprocessPrerender, ::Nothing, ::Observables.Observable{GeometryBasics.HyperRectangle{3,Float32}}, ::Nothing) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLTypes.jl:341
 [7] RenderObject at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/GLAbstraction/GLTypes.jl:309 [inlined]
 [8] fxaa_postprocessor(::GLMakie.GLFramebuffer) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/postprocessing.jl:185
 [9] GLMakie.Screen(; resolution::Tuple{Int64,Int64}, visible::Bool, title::String, kw_args::Base.Iterators.Pairs{Union{},Union{},Tuple{},NamedTuple{(),Tuple{}}}) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/screen.jl:333
 [10] Screen at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/screen.jl:289 [inlined]
 [11] global_gl_screen at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/screen.jl:235 [inlined]
 [12] global_gl_screen(::Tuple{Int64,Int64}, ::Bool, ::Int64) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/screen.jl:369
 [13] global_gl_screen at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/screen.jl:368 [inlined]
 [14] backend_display at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/GLMakie/V1pC5/src/display.jl:2 [inlined]
 [15] display(::AbstractPlotting.Scene) at /home/salmon/.julia/packages/AbstractPlotting/3blWv/src/display.jl:61```
Does anyone know why this might happen or how I might be able to debug this?
I am using Julia 1.5.3 and GLMakie 0.1.27

text: can you try pinning fileio to <https://github.com/JuliaIO/FileIO.jl/releases/tag/v1.5.0|v1.5.0>?

elements.text: can you try pinning fileio to

text: Actually, I lied. Got confused with my different envs. It's 1.6.0

elements.text: Actually, I lied. Got confused with my different envs. It's 1.6.0

text: I just wanted to write, that it would be a huge coincidence, if FileIO failes this way, just when a new breaking version got released

elements.text: I just wanted to write, that it would be a huge coincidence, if FileIO failes this way, just when a new breaking version got released

text: Ah, you know what... it's got to be that. We run this code internally quite frequently and I have reports on either side of the FileIO release. Just before the release was fine, just after is broken

elements.text: Ah, you know what... it's got to be that. We run this code internally quite frequently and I have reports on either side of the FileIO release. Just before the release was fine, just after is broken

text: Yeah, FileIO@1.6 is pretty much a complete rewrite ... and it actually deletes those shader formats, that I didn't even realize we use, since it was specified all wrong :face_with_rolling_eyes:

elements.text: Yeah, FileIO@1.6 is pretty much a complete rewrite ... and it actually deletes those shader formats, that I didn't even realize we use, since it was specified all wrong

text: Do you think this is a FileIO bug or a GLMakie bug or something else? Not sure if I should be opening an issue somewhere

elements.text: Do you think this is a FileIO bug or a GLMakie bug or something else? Not sure if I should be opening an issue somewhere

text: I'll need to fix GLMakie... It could be seen as a FileIO bug, but GLMakie really sholdn't use FileIO like this
